reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Combatting Wildlife Trafficking by Improveing Understanding of Impacts and Drivers to Help Reduce Demand for Illegal Wildlife products in the Greater Seattle Area

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes Reduce demand for illegal wildlife products in the greater Seattle area and Alaska by improving current understanding of the drivers of wildlife trafficking in and around the greater Seattle area, as well as consumers’ understanding of the issues. Increase cruise passenger awareness of illegal wildlife products in Alaska and their ability to identify the difference between legal and illegally sourced products or handicrafts..
